name: Vegan Chili
description: You definitely won't miss the meat in this spicy vegan chili with cashew sour cream! It's super easy to make and packed with protein!
recipeIngredient: 1  red bell pepper, cut into medium pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Either use a fork to mash the tofu or use your hands until it's all crumbled in small chunks. In a large pan, heat the olive oil and cook the tofu for about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Either use a fork to mash the tofu or use your hands until it's all crumbled in small chunks. In a large pan, heat the olive oil and cook the tofu for about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion and sauté for about 3 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion and sauté for about 3 minutes. Then add the garlic and cook for another minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Then deglaze it with red wine and allow the sauce to thicken for about 2 minutes. Stir in the diced tomatoes, the red bell pepper, the corn, the beans, and the spices and cook for about 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Then deglaze it with red wine and allow the sauce to thicken for about 2 minutes. Stir in the diced tomatoes, the red bell pepper, the corn, the beans, and the spices and cook for about 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the sour cream: Drain the cashews and put all ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the tofu chili with nachos and top it off with some of the cashew sour cream and avocado.
